CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 째C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 째C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBBn: This is a material name, specifically a type of polymer with the abbreviation PffBBn.
2. PC71BM: This is a material name, specifically a type of polymer with the abbreviation PC71BM.
3. PffBB-14: This is a material name, specifically a variant of PffBBn with the number 14.
4. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1): This is a material name, specifically a chemical compound with the structure described.
5. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2): This is a material name, specifically a chemical compound with the structure described.
6. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3): This is a material name, specifically a chemical compound with the structure described.
7. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4): This is a material name, specifically a chemical compound with the structure described.
8. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5): This is a material name, specifically a chemical compound with the structure described.
9. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9): This is a material name, specifically a type of alkylated thiophene with the number of carbon atoms in the alkyl group varying from 6 to 9.
10. Tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is a material name, specifically a type of tri-butylstannane with the alkylthiophene group varying from 10 to 13.
11. Dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17): This is a material name, specifically a type of dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole with the number of carbon atoms in the dithienyl group varying from 14 to 17.
12. 18-21: These are material names, specifically the acceptor units with the numbers 18 to 21.
13. Polymers: This is a general material name for the final polymer products obtained through the Stille polycondensation reaction.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PffBBn
2. PC71BM
3. PffBB-14
4. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1)
5. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2)
6. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3)
7. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4)
8. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5)
9. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9)
10. Tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13)
11. Dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17)
12. 18-21
13. Polymers

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 째C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 째C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBBn: A type of polymer, specifically a series of PffBB-n polymers (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16)
2. PC71BM: A specific material, a blend partner for PffBBn in PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells)
3. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency, a property of the solar cell
4. Voc: Open Circuit Voltage, a property of the solar cell
5. Jsc: Short Circuit Current Density, a property of the solar cell
6. FF: Fill Factor, a property of the solar cell
7. PffBB-14: A specific PffBBn polymer with the strongest aggregation strength/behavior
8. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1): A chemical compound
9. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2): A chemical compound
10. Benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3): A chemical compound
11. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4): A chemical compound
12. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5): A chemical compound
13. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9): A chemical compound
14. Tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): A chemical compound
15. Dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17): A chemical compound
16. Acceptor units (18-21): Specific chemical compounds used as acceptors in the Stille polycondensation reaction
17. Polymers: The final products of the Stille polycondensation reaction.

These are the identified property names and materials mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency
2. Voc: Open Circuit Voltage
3. Jsc: Short Circuit Current Density
4. FF: Fill Factor
5. Maximum PCE: The highest Power Conversion Efficiency achieved for a specific PffBB-14:PC71BM-based PSC
